gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: NOAA GOES-R Series Geostationary Lightning Mapper (GLM) Level 2 Lightning Detection: Events, Groups, and Flashes

gmd:organisationName.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information
GOES-R Algorithm Working Group
GOES-R Algorithm Working Group
GOES-R Series Program
GOES-R Series Program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: The Lightning Detection product contains a list of lightning flashes, and their constituent groups and events. The definition of and relationship among flashes, groups, and events are governed by the following spatial and temporal characteristics: An event represents the signal detected from the cloud top associated with a lightning emission in an individual sensor pixel for a 2ms integration period; A group represents the events detected in adjacent sensor pixels for the same integration period as an event; A flash represents a series of measurements constrained by temporal and spatial extent thresholds that are associated with one or more groups. The parent, child relationship among specific flashes, groups, and events is stored in the product. Data for each flash includes an energy-weighted centroid latitude, longitude location, time span of occurrence, amount of radiant energy, and coverage area. Data for each group includes an energy-weighted centroid latitude, longitude location, mean time of occurrence, amount of radiant energy, and coverage area. Data for each event includes a latitude, longitude location, time of occurrence, and amount of radiant energy. The product includes data quality information for each flash and group. A Lightning Detection product file contains a set of flashes, and its constituent groups and events for a 20 second period. The units of measure for the flash, group, and event radiant energy values is Joules. The units of measure for the flash and group coverage areas is square kilometers.

gmd:purpose.gco:CharacterString: Currently weather forecasters can use lightning data provided by a surface-based network to help "nowcast" severe weather. This is a valuable tool; however, it only has the capability of detecting cloud-to-ground flashes. The GOES-R satellites will have the capability to detect both cloud-to-ground and inter-cloud lightning, through use of the Geostationary Lightning Mapper (GLM). This will help severe weather forecasters identify thunderstorms which are rapidly intensifying, and enable them to issue accurate and timely severe thunderstorm and tornado warnings.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: product-unique lightning event identifier
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: event's time of occurrence (time)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: event latitude coordinate (latitude)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: event longitude coordinate (longitude)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: event radiant energy (lightning_radiant_energy)
product-unique lightning group identifier for one or more events
product-unique lightning group identifier
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: mean time of group's constituent events' times of occurrence (time)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: group centroid (mean constituent event latitude weighted by their energies) latitude coordinate (latitude)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: group centroid (mean constituent event latitude weighted by their energies) longitude coordinate (longitude)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: group area coverage (pixels containing at least one constituent event only)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: group radiant energy (lightning_radiant_energy)
product-unique lightning flash identifier for one or more groups
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: group data quality flags (status_flag)
product-unique lightning flash identifier
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: time of occurrence of first constituent event in flash (time)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: time of occurrence of last constituent event in flash (time)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: flash centroid (mean constituent event latitude weighted by their energies) latitude coordinate (latitude)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: flash centroid (mean constituent event latitude weighted by their energies) longitude coordinate (longitude)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: flash area coverage (pixels containing at least one constituent event only)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: flash radiant energy (lightning_radiant_energy)
GLM L2+ Lightning Detection: flash data quality flags (status_flag)
start time of observations associated with product (time)
start and end time of observations associated with product
central wavelength for lightning data (sensor_band_central_radiation_wavelength)
wavelength range lightning data (full width at half the maximum of the response function)
lightning group maximum time difference among lightning events in a group
lightning flash maximum time difference among lightning events in a flash
latitude coordinate for center of field of view (latitude)
latitude coordinates for north/south extent of field of view
GOES-R latitude / longitude projection
number of lightning events in product
number of lightning groups in product
number of lightning flashes in product
after false event filtering, percent of lightning events navigated by instrument
Flag indicating spacecraft is operating in yaw flip configuration
nominal satellite subpoint latitude (platform latitude) (latitude)
nominal satellite height above GRS 80 ellipsoid (platform altitude) (height_above_reference_ellipsoid)
nominal satellite subpoint longitude (platform longitude) (longitude)
longitude coordinate for center of field of view (longitude)
longitude coordinates for west/east extent of field of view
percent data lost due to uncorrectable L0 errors
container for filenames of dynamic algorithm input data
container for processing parameter filenames
container for algorithm package filename and product version

gmd:statement.gco:CharacterString: The data were produced by the NOAA Office of Satellite and Product Operations (OSPO) and are archived at the NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI).

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: The Lightning Detection product is generated by the sequential execution of Level 0, Level 1b and Level 2+ ground processing algorithms.

gmd:other.gco:CharacterString: NOAA National Centers for Environmental Information

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: NOAA created the National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI) by merging NOAA's National Climatic Data Center (NCDC), National Geophysical Data Center (NGDC), and National Oceanographic Data Center (NODC), including the National Coastal Data Development Center (NCDDC), per the Consolidated and Further Continuing Appropriations Act, 2015, Public Law 113-235. NCEI launched publicly on April 22, 2015.

gmd:maintenanceNote.gco:CharacterString: Bulk metadata change applied on 2018-11-05. See version control repository history for metadata change details.
